column5: For me the usual: Be a better man Lose weight Quit smoking
Go fishing as much as possible   it clears the mind and good for the soul

about 28 years ago I made a resolution to not ever make another resolution and to be happy about where I am and what I am and how I am  I am happy to say I have kept that resolution for all these years and will continue to   I hope
What he said,but I do have one that I will not share at this time.
My wife of 45 years and myself live a wonderful life and I don't want anything to change, therefore, no need for resolutions for me
Resolutions are for people who can't make a decision on any of the other days of the year.
Enjoy the year and go to less funerals
Hear Hear Dan . That a good one  :thumbsup_anim:  Can I steal it?
To look up this word "resolution" right after I learn what "procrastination" means  Michael
No more looking at stupid threads on message boards...
Fish More Work Less Try and drop a few more pounds.
No more betting on "slow" horses and to stop running after "fast" women...
